dcterms:description: NosiyMnist and RotatingMnist are two different views corresponding to each other. NosiyMnist is constructed by adding random noise to the images of RotatingMnist, which consists of digits rotated at random angles.
dcterms:title: NosiyMnist-RotatingMnist

dcterms:description: Mnist-USPS is a dataset that treats Mnist and USPS as two different views of handwritten digits, each containing 5000 samples.
dcterms:title: Mnist-USPS

dcterms:creator: Han Xiao

dcterms:description: Fashion-10K consists of 10,000 gray images of clothing items, categorized into 10 different classes. The dataset is used to benchmark machine learning algorithms.
dcterms:title: Fashion-10K

dcterms:creator: Han Xiao
Kashif Rasul
Roland Vollgraf
dcterms:description: Mnist-10K uses the test set of the Mnist dataset, which contains 10,000 samples of handwritten digits.
dcterms:title: Mnist-10K
